DataElement.preferredDefinition: Identification of the status of active autoimmune issues post bone marrow transplantation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Active Autoimmune Disease Timepoint Post Transplantation Disease Response
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event._Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order._Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species._The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression._Exerting influence or producing an effect; taking part in an activity._A disorder resulting from loss of function or tissue destruction of an organ or multiple organs, arising from humoral or cellular immune responses of the individual to his own tissue constituents. It may be systemic (e.g., systemic lupus erythematosus), or organ specific, (e.g., thyroiditis).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Exerting influence or producing an effect; taking part in an activity.:A condition in which the body recognizes its own tissues as foreign and directs an immune response against them.

Concepts.definition: Exerting influence or producing an effect.

A disorder resulting from loss of function or tissue destruction of an organ or multiple organs, arising from humoral or cellular immune responses of the individual to his own tissue constituents. It may be systemic (e.g., systemic lupus erythematosus), or organ specific, (e.g., thyroiditis).

Property.preferredDefinition: A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.:Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.:Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.:The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

Concepts.definition: A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.
Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.
The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Curated to support NCI CCR Primary Immunosuppression CRF template.10.21.2016.dmr

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

PermissibleValues.value: Active autoimmune issues with no further intervention
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Active Without Further Intervention or Procedure Autoimmune Disease

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Active Without Further Intervention or Procedure Autoimmune Disease
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Exerting influence or producing an effect; taking part in an activity.: Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone.: To or at a greater distance in time or space.: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.: A condition in which the body recognizes its own tissues as foreign and directs an immune response against them.

Concepts.definition: Exerting influence or producing an effect.
Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone.
To or at a greater distance in time or space.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.

A disorder resulting from loss of function or tissue destruction of an organ or multiple organs, arising from humoral or cellular immune responses of the individual to his own tissue constituents. It may be systemic (e.g., systemic lupus erythematosus), or organ specific, (e.g., thyroiditis).

PermissibleValues.value: Active autoimmune issues despite further intervention
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Active With Further Intervention or Procedure Immune Disease

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Active With Further Intervention or Procedure Immune Disease
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Exerting influence or producing an effect; taking part in an activity.: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.: To or at a greater distance in time or space.: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.: A disorder resulting from an abnormality in the immune system.

Concepts.definition: Exerting influence or producing an effect.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
To or at a greater distance in time or space.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
A disorder resulting from an abnormality in the immune system.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Physiologic Resolution With Further Intervention or Procedure Autoimmune Disease

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Physiologic Resolution With Further Intervention or Procedure Autoimmune Disease
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Return to the normal structure and/or function, e.g. the subsidence of a pathologic process, as the subsidence of an inflammatory lesion or new growth.: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.: To or at a greater distance in time or space.: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.: A condition in which the body recognizes its own tissues as foreign and directs an immune response against them.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.

A disorder resulting from loss of function or tissue destruction of an organ or multiple organs, arising from humoral or cellular immune responses of the individual to his own tissue constituents. It may be systemic (e.g., systemic lupus erythematosus), or organ specific, (e.g., thyroiditis).
